com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.websites

Interface WebSiteManagementClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, FilterableService<WebSiteManagementClient>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WebSiteManagementClientImpl

    public interface WebSiteManagementClient
extends java.io.Closeable, FilterableService<WebSiteManagementClient>
    The Web Sites Management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with the Windows Azure Web Sites service to manage your web sites. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and Windows Azure Web Sites service. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166981.aspx for more information)

      • getOperationStatus

        WebSiteOperationStatusResponse getOperationStatus(java.lang.String webSpaceName,
                                                java.lang.String siteName,
                                                java.lang.String operationId)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                                         ServiceException,
                                                         javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                         org.xml.sax.SAXException
        The Get Operation Status operation returns the status of the specified operation. After calling a long-running operation, you can call Get Operation Status to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, timed out, or is still in progress. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460783.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        webSpaceName - Required. The name of the webspace for the website where the operation was targeted.
        siteName - Required. The name of the site where the operation was targeted.
        operationId - Required. The operation ID for the operation you wish to track. The operation ID is returned in the ID field in the body of the response for long-running operations.
        Returns:
        The response body contains the status of the specified long-running operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, has timed out, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the long-running operation failed, the response body includes error information regarding the failure.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was a serious configuration error with the document parser.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the XML response.

      • getOperationStatusAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<WebSiteOperationStatusResponse> getOperationStatusAsync(java.lang.String webSpaceName,
                                                                                  java.lang.String siteName,
                                                                                  java.lang.String operationId)
        The Get Operation Status operation returns the status of the specified operation. After calling a long-running operation, you can call Get Operation Status to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, timed out, or is still in progress. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460783.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        webSpaceName - Required. The name of the webspace for the website where the operation was targeted.
        siteName - Required. The name of the site where the operation was targeted.
        operationId - Required. The operation ID for the operation you wish to track. The operation ID is returned in the ID field in the body of the response for long-running operations.
        Returns:
        The response body contains the status of the specified long-running operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, has timed out, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the long-running operation failed, the response body includes error information regarding the failure.
